results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/04]
results.brief_description: French cineagazine items including: 1. Grenoble, Olympic capital - On the eve of the Winter Olympics, Grenoble has had its face lifted. She is ready for this major sports competition. 2. Sports - Rugby: a good start for the French team in the 5 nations tournament. 3. Metal woman - Is metallurgy going into women’s fashions? Coats of mail and helmets have become the newest “material”. 4. Canada and modern art - A new exhibition in Paris, launched by the words of Andre Malraux “An absolutely specific palette has arisen - that of Canada”. 5. Master copyists - Purposeful or accidental? A Parisian art-collector has asembled an impressive collection of masterpieces with strange analogies. Says Salvador Dali: “Perrugino painted immortal canvases; Raphael copied them, and suddenly the miracle of Raphael’s originality came to the fore”.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/??]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. Nouvelle ligne - The description and style of the Soy Peugeot highlighting the qualities and features of this new car. 2. The fashion designer, Louis Feraud, takes us through his Autumn Collection that is stylish, innovative and youthful. 3. The Oscar winner, Maurice Chevalier, shows his diverse passions and drive to keep acting at the age of 80. 4. Chateau Brand, the French writer and founder of Romanticism, died in 1818. This is about his life and times in France.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 67/18]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. The Cannes Festival - opening of the Cannes Film Festival showing glimpses of celebrities including Gina Lollobrigida, Annie Girardot, Yves Montand, Geraldine Chaplin, Claude Lelouch. 2. Art in the raw and therapy art: An exhibition at the Musee des Art Decoraties of “L’Art Brut”. St Anne’s Hospital for the mentally ill has introduced art sessions for its patients. 3. Chantiers Sous-Marins - focuses on the training of professional skin-divers. 4. A stroll in the past - presents one of Paris’ 60 villages. 5. France’s most spectacular historical gardens.
